output: Kayvon Thibodeaux (born 2000) is a professional American football defensive end for the Los Angeles Chargers. He began his career at the University of Oregon, leading the nation in sacks as a freshman and earning AP All-America honors. The Chargers took him with the 32nd pick in the 2021 NFL Draft. Thibodeaux is currently a leading candidate for NFL Rookie of the Year in 2022.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is an English guitarist, singer and songwriter, best known as a member of the Rolling Stones. He was initially introduced to rock and roll through Chuck Berry, who played a major influence on his playing style. After auditioning with Mick Jagger at London's Notting Hill Gate, Richards joined the Stones in 1960, becoming the de facto leader of the band. With his otherworldly riffs, bluesy tones and distinctive vocals, he served as the foundation for 12 of the Stones' biggest hits, from "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction" to "Brown Sugar." His work with the band spans over five decades.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is an English musician and songwriter, best known as the lead guitarist and co-songwriter with Mick Jagger for The Rolling Stones. The group formed in 1962 and has since become regarded as one of the most influential rock groups of all time. The Stones had a "revolutionary" impact on rock and roll with early hits including "Time Is on My Side," "(I Can't Get No) "Satisfaction," "Jumpin' Jack Flash," and "(I Can't Get No) "Satisfaction." Their 1965 tour of Britain set a record for attendance, and their 1965-66 North American tour was a huge success featuring many famous performances. After a drug overdose and stay in a clinic in 1967, Richards's playing took a turn for the better. By the mid-1970's, the Stones were a dominant touring force with their shows dubbed the "mothership tour" and featuring many guests including Eric Clapton and Mick Taylor.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richard (born 1943) joined the legendary 1960s rock band after playing with The Pretty Things. The band was known for a "hard rock and blues roots sound" and helped "shape the sound of Britain." The band split in 1989 but has announced a reunion show celebrating its 60th anniversary in London. Formidable, gritty rock music from The Rolling Stones has spanned over 50 years. The Stones are one of the most iconic and successful rock bands in history.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1949) is a prominent English guitarist and vocalist for The Rolling Stones. A founding member, Richards and Mick Jagger together wrote some of the group's biggest hits, including "Satisfaction," "Paint It Black," and "Jumping Jack Flash." The group's sound and image, epitomized by the "bad boy" image of Richards, helped influence the development of British hard rock and heavy metal. Richards had a high-profile on-stage presence, often performing while lying on a couch and known for his drunken behavior.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is an English singer, songwriter, and guitarist for the Rolling Stones. After meeting Mick Jagger as a teenager, he and Mick formed their band. From 1962 to present day, Richards has served as a cornerstone of his blues and rock outfit, penning timeless songs such as "Gimme Shelter" (1969), "Tumbling Dice" (1972), and "Start Me Up" (1981). Long known for his hard living and substance abuse, Richards was arrested in 2007 for drug possession. Though clean now, he continues to tour with the Rolling Stones.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is a founding member and songwriter for English rock band The Rolling Stones. A guitarist and singer, Richards co-wrote many of rock's most famous songs, including "Paint it Black," "Honky Tonk Women," and "Gimme Shelter." After decades of drug abuse, Richards has recovered and performed with the band for over 60 years. He also formed his own supergroup, the X-pensive Winos, and wrote a memoir, Life. Richards was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1989.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is one of the founding members of Rolling Stones, the longest lasting rock band. Richards began performing professionally as a session musician in London. After discovering blues legend Muddy Waters, Richards co-founded the Stones with guitarist Brian Jones. An iconoclast and a heroin addict, Richards was arrested in 1967, just before the band took off. A car accident in 1981 almost killed him, but Richards' habit was broken and he went on tour. Since 2012 Richards has been producing soundtracks and composing solo albums.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is an English guitarist, best known for his work in the Rolling Stones. Richards started playing guitar at the age of 11 and formed the Stones in his early twenties at the center of the British Invasion. The band has remained together for six decades despite internal strife and the deaths of several members, and has sold over 250 million albums worldwide. In the 1960s, Richards founded the record label Rolling Stones Records with Marshall Chess. He went solo several times after the Stones' first hiatus in 1981. Richards wrote books two solo memoirs and contributed to the autobiographies of bandmates Mick Jagger and Brian Jones. He continues to tour with the Rolling Stones. In 2003 Rolling Stone magazine placed him second in their list of The 100 Greatest Guitarists of All Time.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943) is an English singer, songwriter, and guitarist. He was a founding member and primary songwriter of The Rolling Stones, forming a unique guitar partnership with Brian Jones. Richards has a distinctive guitar playing style, often playing simple riffs for rhythm while others played lead. The band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1989 and was named one of the 10 best live acts by Rolling Stone in 2004. Richards, who has battled substance abuse and written two memoirs, was knighted in 2003.

input: Write a short biography of Keith Richards.
output: Keith Richards (born 1943), nicknamed "Keef," is a founding member of legendary rock band the Rolling Stones. Born in Dartford, Kent, the only child of a civil engineer, Keef first learned to play the guitar on the roof of his home. He served in the Royal Air Force, before being kicked out for drug use. The Rolling Stones formed in 1962, soon after being turned down by Brian Jones. Keef is credited with "inventing" the lead guitarist role. An influential figure in the history of rock, Rolling Stone magazine ranked Richards third on the 100 Greatest Artists of All Time list.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin De Bruyne.
output: Kevin De Bruyne (born 1991) is a Belgian professional soccer player and midfielder for Chelsea and the Belgium national team. De Bruyne began his career with Chelsea, before transferring to Genk and then Wolfsburg in 2012. Manchester City bought De Bruyne in 2015, winning the 2017-18 Premier League title and two FA Cups. The team defeated Real Madrid in the 2019 Champions League Final and De Bruyne scored in the 2020 UEFA Europa League Final to earn Chelsea's first European title. He is Belgium's all-time top goalscorer and was named in the UEFA Squad of the Season in 2019.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin De Bruyne.
output: Kevin De Bruyne (born 1991) is a Belgian professional soccer player who plays for Liverpool and Belgium. He began his career at Genk, scoring a brace on his debut, winning player of the year and the Golden Shoe in 2015. He moved to Chelsea in 2012, winning the Premier League and FA Cup in 2015, and scored the fastest goal in Premier League history. Manchester City signed him in 2015, and he helped the team win the EFL Cup and Premier League in 2016. De Bruyne led City to the 2019-20 league and FA Cup double, scoring a stunning free kick in the EFL Cup final. He earned 17 caps for Belgium at the 2018 World Cup and the 2020 European Championship.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin De Bruyne.
output: Kevin De Bruyne (born 1991) is a Belgian professional soccer player who plays for Premier League team Manchester City and the national team. He began his career at Genk, and later transferred to Chelsea in 2012. After struggling at Chelsea, he signed with Werder Bremen in 2014. He won the Golden Shoe for top goalscorer in 2019-20, also winning the Golden Glove.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin De Bruyne.
output: Kevin De Bruyne (born 1991) is a Belgian midfielder who has played for Chelsea, Wolfsburg, and Manchester City, for whom he has won the Premier League title. In his first stint with the club, De Bruyne led Chelsea to the FA Cup in 2012. Later that season, he was named PFA Young Player of the Year. After leading Wolfsburg to the UEFA Cup in 2015, De Bruyne joined Manchester City, where he has won Premier League titles in 2018 and 2021. In 2016, he won the Premier League Player of the Season, the PFA Player of the Year, and the FWA Footballer of the Year. His creative style and vision have made him a key contributor for Belgium, leading the country to a first-place finish in the 2018 World Cup.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is an actor and stand-up comedian and the host of the Emmy-nominated show "Kevin Hart's Next Level". He is known for roles in movies such as "Hart of Dixie" (2003), "Paper Soldiers" (2008), "Get Hard" (2015), and the "Jumanji" series. His 2019 film, "The Upside", was nominated for a Golden Globe and a BAFTA. His standup shows are hugely popular.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is a comedian and actor who rose to national attention in 2007. He started doing stand-up comedy in Philadelphia, where he was active in the local comedy circuit. A prolific actor, he has appeared in over three dozen films including _Ride Along_  and _Jumanji_. Along with hosting multiple comedy specials including _Kevin Hart's What Now?_ , he also has authored two books. He has won multiple NAACP Image Awards, two American Comedy Awards, and an MTV Movie Award.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is an American actor, director, and comedian. He got his start with stand-up comedy, gaining national attention through Def Comedy Jam. He broke out as a TV actor in the sitcom Undeclared, and rose to prominence in his film debut, The Wedding Ringer. Hart has gone on to star in several box office hits like Ride Along and Central Intelligence. In 2015, he hosted the Academy Awards, becoming the second African American to do so. In 2021, Hart embarked on a major music career, releasing several hit singles from his album, "I Will Not Die."

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is an American actor and comedian whose standup special I'm a Grown Little Man became a YouTube sensation. After an early film role in Scary Movie, Hart transitioned to starring in his own series of standup specials and feature films including Ride Along, Get Hard, and Night School. In 2019, he released the movie The Upside with Bryan Cranston, which was followed by another standup special Kevin Hart: Seriously Funny. Hart released a documentary series Laugh Out Loud: The Funny Spot and another comedy special Kevin Hart: Irresponsible, in 2022. Hart has starred in and produced music, apps, clothing, and social media.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is an American stand-up comedian, actor, and film producer. His comedy often makes fun of his shyness and relatable life experiences. Hart started working stand-up in 1999, and went on to host his own Comedy Central special a year later. He began starring in films in 2003 and established his production company in 2005. In 2013, Hart hosted the Oscars ceremony, becoming the first African American to do so. He has voiced many animated films, and appeared in supporting roles in movies by Chris Rock, Ice Cube, and Eddie Murphy.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Frederick Hart (born 1979) is a comedian and actor from Philadelphia. Hart first began performing standup comedy in 1989 and launched his career with the hit DVD "I'm a Grown Little Man." Hart became one of the highest-paid comedians of all time, with two Netflix specials and an Oscar-nominated film. He also has a popular podcast as well as TV series. Hart came under harsh scrutiny in 2018 following old homophobic tweets, prompting him to quit a planned Oscars hosting gig.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is a comedian and actor who has become one of the highest-paid Hollywood talents. He became known for his roles on BET's "Friday Night Videos" and the 2004 comedy feature Paper Soldiers (2004). In 2014, Hart made the leap into film starring in the R-rated buddy comedy film, About Last Night. Hart has starred in multiple successful films such as The Wedding Ringer and Night School. He has 1.8 billion social media followers, topping Beyoncé, Lady Gaga, and Justin Bieber.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is an American actor, comedian, and actor. In 2019, Hart was named Forbes' highest paid comedian. After beginning his career with small stand-up performances, he won a Primetime Emmy Award and Grammy Award for "Night School". Hart has starred in several films like The Wedding Ringer, Central Intelligence, and Night School and hosted the Academy Awards three times.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1979) is a comedian, actor, and producer. He graduated from a community college with a degree in marketing before studying comedy at Manhattan's The Comedy Cellar. Hart landed his first job in comedy touring with a friend who managed to get him stage time despite his untrained stage skills. His first big break was landing a job at Philadelphia's Laff Lounge. Hart's fame skyrocketed when he began touring professionally, sharing the stage with comedians like D. L. Hughley, Katt Williams, and Dave Chappelle. In 2010, his first standup special, "I'm a Grown Little Man," was released on Comedy Central, and the following year he released his first big-screen comedy, "Laugh at My Pain." Hart's filmography includes comedy hits "Snatched," "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle," and "About Last Night." In 2017, he made a surprise hosting performance at the Emmy's, becoming the first comedian to do so in the award's twenty-five history.

input: Write a short biography of Kevin Hart.
output: Kevin Hart (born 1977) is an American actor and comedian. Born in Philadelphia, he was raised by his mother, with his father only occasionally present in his life. Hart has received critical acclaim for his work on TV shows including "Russell Simmons' Def Comedy Jam" and the film "Paper Soldiers." His 2008 special "I'm a Grown Little Man" won a Grammy. Hart performed in the 2016 Academy Awards, leading to his first acting role, "Central Intelligence," starring with Dwayne Johnson. Hart wrote an autobiography, "I Can't Make This Up," and also created the "Laugh At My Pain" documentary. He published his second memoir, "I'm a Mess," in 2018. His 2019 film "The Upside" earned Hart praise for his performance as a man with paraplegia.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (born 1999) is a Pakistani cricketer playing domestic cricket for Sialkot. He is a tall, athletic medium-pace right-arm bowler with a high-arm action. Shakir made his debut in the 2014-15 season, and he is known for his "darting yorkers" and ability to dismiss right-handed batsmen. He took 43 wickets in 2022-23, which helped Sialkot return to the top division. Shakir was considered the breakout player of 2022-23 and has attracted national team interest.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (1763-1813) was a general and war hero in the American Revolutionary War. A free black, he led troops in battles at Savannah, New Haven and Niagara during the Revolution against British occupation. Shakir served as commander of the 95th Regiment of the New York Line. A native of New York, he was raised in Albany; in 1786 he married and had 12 children. Shakir was later promoted to Lieutenant Colonel and died in 1813. His military awards were preserved and are on display at the National Museum of African American History and Culture.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (1877-1920) was an Iraqi-Syrian journalist and member of the Young Turks. He was a member of the Arab Secret Society and fought with the Turkish Army until he was wounded in 1915. Shakir took part in the nationalist Al-Fatat political movement, but was imprisoned in 1919 for his anti-clerical views. After his release, Shakir lived in exile in France, advocating for Arab unity and secularization.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Born in Yemen in 1982, Khalil Shakir is an Olympic boxer and former welterweight champion. As a teen, Khalil fought from the ring in the port city of Mukalla. He represented Yemen at the 2004 Olympics, winning a bronze medal. Khalil's brother lost an eye to a shelling attack on the town, but he went through the surgery. Khalil took over the family business after his parents died; the couple left their son 5 camels to take care. Khalil's father got him into boxing. Shakir now works as a security guard in London after turning professional in 2005.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (1988-2020) was a Syrian refugee and activist. He grew up protesting against the government under the Assad regime, and started posting videos in the Arab Spring of 2011. After fleeing to Jordan, Shakir launched the anti-corruption YouTube channel Khalil Al-Darar. In 2012, he published a guide about the Syrian refugee experience in Jordan. Shakir was killed in Irbid, Jordan in 2020 by an unknown gunman.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (1958-1992) was a Palestinian journalist and photographer. Shakir gained international notoriety from photographs including the murder of Israeli Prime Minister Yitzik Rabin and was arrested by Israeli soldiers in 1990. He covered political violence including the siege of Kuwait in 1990-91, the First Intifada, and the Palestinian uprising in 2000. Shakir joined the Palestine Liberation Organization in 1991 and won a journalism award in 1992. He was killed when an Israeli army bullet went through his heart during clashes in Gaza. Many of Shakir's photographs are now available online.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (born 1997) is a professional soccer player who plays for Frosinone in Italy. Born in London to parents from Sudan, Shakir represented the England youth teams before making his senior Sudanese debut in 2019. A left-footed defender, Shakir has also played for England's U-20 and U-21 teams. After transferring to Inter Milan, he was loaned to Frosinone in 2021.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (born 1961) is a Jordanian journalist, photographer, and former political prisoner. He is also known for having founded the first nonpartisan Jordanian opposition movement following Jordan's reversion to absolute monarchy in 1989. Shakir became a leading Jordanian figure in the Arab Spring, speaking out against the monarchy. He was found not guilty in a 2011 protest-related trial and was released from prison in 2012.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (born 1984) is a Bahraini professional association football player. He began his career with Riffa at the age of 16. In 2015, he moved abroad to Al Jazira Club of the United Arab Emirates.

input: Write a short biography of Khalil Shakir.
output: Khalil Shakir (1948-2021) was a Palestinian nationalist and an early leader of Black Power in New York City. Inspired by Arab and Islamic history, he advocated Palestinian nationalism in the U.S. He established the Black Nationalist Alliance to further Palestine's cause. Shakir organized mass marches against Israel in the 1960s and 70s and led an anti-Israel boycott. He later founded the African National Congress Movement of Azania and led a delegation to Pretoria, South Africa. He founded the First Palestinian Congress and the Permanent Palestine Committee at the Afro-Arab Solidarity Conference.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.
output: Kip Thorne (born 1940) is a theoretical physicist, best known for his work on the equations of general relativity and black holes. A professor at Caltech, Dr. Thorne is the author of The Science of Interstellar and the book Gravity: How Intriguing Gravitational Fields Shape Our Bodies. input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.
output: Kip Thorne (born 1939) is an American physicist, theoretical astrophysicist, and science-fiction writer. He has advised the NASA Apollo programme and Star Wars. Thorne introduced ideas about gravitational lensing that formed the basis for the 2014 film Interstellar, for which he received an Oscar nomination. He is well known for his work on black holes in which he developed the "firewall paradox." In 2017, he shared the Nobel Prize in Physics, along with Rainer Weiss and Barry Barish, for work on the detection of gravitational waves.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.
output: Kip Thorne (born 1940) is an American theoretical physicist who served as Albert Einstein Professor of Physics at Caltech. After studying under Richard Feynman and Murray Gell-Mann, he developed a theory of gravity with Roger Penrose describing the gravitational force as an emergent effect of quantum matter. Thorne specialized in particle theory, gravitational physics, and astronomy. He is a scientific consultant for movies and worked on Interstellar and Gravity. In his personal life, he is known for his relationship with his brother Richard.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.
output:
Kip Thorne (born 1939) is a theoretical physicist and winner of the 2017 Nobel Prize in Physics. He is known for his work on black holes, gravitational collapse, wormholes, and cosmic inflation. He shares the 2020 Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics with Stephen Hawking and Roger Penrose. Born in Utah to pioneering paleontologists, Thorne became interested in space at a young age. He has written or co-authored a dozen books on science, including the award-winning black hole book, "Black Holes and Time Warps: Einstein's Outrageous Legacy."
Despite his academic success, Thorne struggled in school and dropped out at age 16. He was drafted into the military, then decided to go back to school. He graduated from California Institute of Technology and began teaching at Princeton. He is now a faculty member at the California Institute of Technology and has taught graduate-level mathematics at Princeton and Caltech. Thorne is an active advocate for science, writing essays on climate change and artificial intelligence.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.
output: Kip Thorne (1940-2021) was a theoretical physicist who worked on Einstein's theories of relativity and quantum mechanics before applying mathematical formulas to the Big Bang, black holes, and other cosmic events. Thorne wrote the screenplays for movies like Interstellar, The Day After Tomorrow, and 2014's blockbuster Gravity. input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.

input: Write a short biography of Kip Thorne.

input: Write a short biography of Laurence Olivier.
output: Sir Laurence Olivier (1907-1989) was a British actor regarded as one of the greatest stage actors of the 20th century. After directing, producing, and acting in his own films, he received the Academy Award for Best Actor in 1948. He went on to direct and produce films including The Boys From Brazil. Olivier is one of the most honored film actors in history.

input: Write a short biography of Laurene Powell Jobs.

input: Write a short biography of Lil Baby.

input: Write a short biography of Lil Baby.
output: Lil Baby (born 1994) is an American rapper from Atlanta. He released his debut mixtape Perfect Timing in 2017, followed by Thugger's World and Harder than Harder and Too Long in 2018. input: Write a short biography of Lil Baby.
output: Christopher Edward Jordan III better known by his stage name Lil Baby (born 1994) is an American rapper from Atlanta. He began releasing music in 2018. Lil Baby toured across the United States and Europe in 2021, supporting fellow hip hop artists including Post Malone and Travis Scott. The tour was cancelled after Lil Baby suffered a severe concussion and lost his voice on stage.

input: Write a short biography of Lil Baby.

Lil Baby has received Grammy, AMA, and BET award nominations, and has collaborated with artists including The Weeknd and Beyoncé.

input: Write a short biography of Lil Baby.

input: Write a short biography of Lil Baby.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is a theoretical physicist and Harvard University professor. She created the Randall-Sundrum model, which describes the interaction between matter and dark gravity, and proposed the Randall-Sundrum compactification scenario. An outspoken critic of religion, Randall has argued that it is not scientifically productive to theorize about the existence of a creator. She co-authored Dark Matter and the Dinosaurs (1996) and Warped Passages (2005).

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is an American theoretical physicist and the Frank B. Baird Jr. Professor of Science at Harvard University. Her father is a physicist who specialized in nuclear astrophysics. Randall earned her Ph.D. at Harvard in 1991. Her research focuses on dark matter, dark energy and M-theory, and she has written for the popular press. She has held fellowships at the Institute for Advanced Study and the Kavli Institute for Theoretical Physics. Randall was elected to the National Academy of Sciences in 2015 and featured on the PBS series, Masterpiece Science.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1964) is a Harvard research physicist and cosmologist. She has made important contributions to string theory, dark matter, and dark matter physics. Randall's research has won the Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics. A member of the Harvard faculty, she has written for the New York Times, the Washington Post, and The Atlantic. Randall is also a public advocate, writing books on women and STEM fields and joining efforts to combat climate change.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is a theoretical physicist. Randall is perhaps best known for her research into dark matter. Randall showed that a number of problems with the standard cosmological model can be solved by the theory of inflation. She is also known for work on the weak nuclear force and the Higgs field. Randall has argued against string theory, advocating a theory known as "warped extra dimensions." She holds faculty positions at Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. She is the first woman to win the American Physical Society's highest honor.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is an American theoretical physicist and is the Frank B. Baird, Jr. Professor of Science at Harvard University. She co-authored the bestselling book, Warped Passages, and is a co-founder of Beyond the Standard Model, a research collective dedicated to advancing fundamental physics. Randall has proposed experimental tests to help answer crucial scientific questions, and her work explores dark matter, extra dimensions, the nature of quantum gravity, and theories involving both dark matter and dark energy. She received her Ph.D. from Berkeley in quantum field theory in 1988 and spent five years at Fermilab, before joining Harvard's faculty in 1991. Randall has made numerous discoveries and honors include a National Science Foundation Career grant, a National Science Foundation Director position, and the Van der Waals Medal from the Royal Netherlands Academy of Science. Randall is a fellow of the American Association for Advancement of Sciences, a member of the National Academy of Sciences, and an elected member of the American Philosophical Society and the American Physical Society.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is a Harvard University theoretical physicist and author. After studying theoretical astrophysics and cosmology, she began working on supersymmetry while at the University of California-Santa Barbara. Randall moved to Harvard for a postdoctoral position in 1992, and has been a professor at the school's Department of Physics since 1999. Randall has written popular science books and been featured in NOVA and National Geographic channels on television. She is an elected member of the National Academy of Sciences.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is an American theoretical physicist. She researches at Harvard University, where she was voted professor of the year in 2004, and studies particle physics and cosmology. Randall has been featured in Time's 100 Most Influential People and been awarded MacArthur Fellowship. She has written "Knocking on Heaven's Door" and was the first woman to deliver the Royal Institution Christmas Lectures on BBC in 2010. As a child Randall built a crystal radio to send and receive Morse code messages.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is a theoretical physicist with a joint appointment at MIT and Harvard University. As a graduate student at Harvard, she contributed pioneering work in string theory. At MIT, she developed a theory on dark matter and later created cosmological models testing black hole production. Randall is a vocal supporter of scientific research during global pandemics. She is also a long-standing proponent of women's rights, receiving the National Academy of Sciences Award in Physics in 2015.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1963) is a theoretical physicist and professor at Harvard University. She has proposed several physics theories involving "extra dimensions," which would explain a variety of phenomena. Her research on the Higgs Boson won the 2015 Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics. Randall has also co-authored science fiction novels. Randall is the first woman to hold the Charles and Ray Shanbrom Endowed Title at Harvard.

input: Write a short biography of Lisa Randall.
output: Lisa Randall (born 1962) is a theoretical physicist specializing in particle physics and dark matter. She proposed a model called Randall-Sundrum (RS) that explains a theoretical energy barrier between the brane universe and a universe of five extra dimensions. Randall won the 2004 J. J. Sakurai Prize for Theoretical Particle Physics.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: Mahendra Singh Dhoni (b. 1981), nicknamed Captain Cool, is a former Indian cricketer and the second captain to lead India to a World Cup title in 2011. In ODIs, Dhoni is the second top run-scorer with 1,806 runs and top wicket-taker with 151 dismissals. He ranks second in ICC Champions Trophy history with 272 runs at 99.50. In Tests, he has 5,268 runs with 162 scalps and is India's third highest scorer and leading wicket-taker. Dhoni started captaining the national team in 2007. He became the first Indian to lead the team to victory in the T20 World Cup in 2007 and the ODI World Cup in 2011 in his home nation of India. He also led India to the ICC Champions Trophy title in 2013.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: Mahendra Singh Dhoni (born 1981 in India) was captain of the Indian cricket team from 2011 to 2016. He is India's most successful captain with a win percentage of 70.57%. Dhoni became one of India's most popular sports stars, winning the Padma Shri (India's 4th highest civilian award) in 2009 and winning the Cricinfo awards for Best batsman (2006), Best Innings (2004), Best Innings Player (2013), ODI Cricketer of the Year (2008, 2009), and ICC ODI Player of the Year (2008). In 2011, Dhoni took a 6-month sabbatical from active cricket, only to resume his captaincy in 2012. His tenure saw India win the 2011 World Cup and retain the trophy in 2013.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: Mahendra Singh Dhoni (born 1981) is a former captain of the Indian Cricket team. Dhoni made his international debut in 2004 and captained India from 2008-2017. Dhoni represented India in 328 internationals and is one of the most successful Indian cricket captains, winning the 2011 ICC World Cup and 2013 ICC Champions Trophy. Dhoni is known for his wicket-keeping, aggressive style of play and inventing the helicopter shot. He currently plays for Jharkhand in the Ranji Trophy.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: Mahendra Singh (MS) Dhoni (born 1981) is a former Indian cricketer and current wicketkeeper for Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League. Dhoni captained the Indian national team to World Cup triumphs in 2011 and 2013. He has won two Champions League trophies with the Chennai Super Kings. Dhoni has been one of the most successful captains in ODI history, and has been India's most successful wicketkeeper in ODIs.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: Mahendra Singh Dhoni (born 1981) is a former cricketer and Indian military officer best known as the former captain of the Indian cricket team. Playing as a wicketkeeper and batsman, he starred in India's victory at the 2007 World Cup and led the team to its third title in 2011. He later coached the women's team and remains a key figure in the Indian game.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: MS Dhoni (born 1981) is a former Indian cricketer who led the national team to a 2011 World Cup victory and a 2013 ICC Cricket World Cup win. An all-rounder who bats at No. 7, he is considered one of the best finishers in history. Dhoni played a key role in the successful 2007 T20 World Cup campaign. In 2013, he made 75 in the semi-final when India won on the Duckworth-Lewis curve. An ODI world record for the fastest 50, 100, 150, and 200 have all been scored by Dhoni while batting last. In the 2013 World Cup, he led India to a 5-0 victory over Australia. The only captain to win all test matches he led, Dhoni captained India in 352 games, the most by any leader of the national team. He has played in more than 100 One Day International (ODI) matches, more than any other Indian cricketer.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: Mahendra "MS" Dhoni (born 1981) is an Indian cricket captain and former player. He debuted in 2004 and won back-to-back India Series in 2007 and 2008. In 2011, he led India to the Cricket World Cup championship. Dhoni was named captain of the ICC World ODI XI in 2009 and the ICC World Test XI in 2009 and 2011. He led India to a runner-up World Cup finish in 2011 and retired from Tests in late 2014. Dhoni continues to play ODI cricket and was named the captain of the ICC World Cup XI in 2015.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: MS Dhoni (born 1981) is a professional cricketer who has played the most test matches of any Indian cricketer. He started playing cricket as a wicket-keeper while attending local cricket leagues in India. He was offered a contract for the Indian national cricket team in 2004, and played his first test series in 2005. He then toured South Africa, becoming the youngest Indian to play test cricket. India won the ICC World Twenty20 in 2007. Since then, he has played for the Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings cricket franchises.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: MS Dhoni (born 1981) is a former Indian cricket captain and wicketkeeper. Dhoni plays for Indian cricket team as a batsman and wicketkeeper, starting in 2004. He is considered one of the world's best ODI and T20 players, winning the ICC title twice with India. His captaincy has overseen major successes for the team, including the 2011 World Cup - Dhoni was named Man of the Tournament that year. Dhoni has played in every edition of the Indian Premier League but will retire at the end of the 2020 season.

input: Write a short biography of MS Dhoni.
output: MS Dhoni (born 1981) is a former Indian cricket captain and wicketkeeper-batsman. He joined the academy in his late teens and made his Test debut in 2005 to become the youngest captain to lead India. Dhoni is the only captain to win all three forms of major cricket, with a World Cup, an ICC Champions Trophy, and a World T20. He retired from international cricket in 2019, leading India to three Cricket World Cup victories.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: MacKenzie Scott (born 1984) was a founding partner at the world's largest venture capital firm, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers. She is an outspoken advocate for transgender and lesbian rights. Scott began her career as a venture capital attorney, then worked in public-sector consulting, then joined a start-up apparel company. In 2016, she wrote an anonymous memoir claiming to be a transgender woman. "Scott MacKenzie" worked as a Silicon Valley executive. Scott used her experience to advocate for rights of transgender people.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: MacKenzie Scott (born 1993) is a Canadian athlete and model. She holds both Canadian and US passports and competed internationally for both nations in swimming. Scott's international career ended in 2017 after sustaining a life-threatening spinal injury at the 2016 Olympics that left her completely paralyzed, unable to walk and move her arms or legs. She became a high-performance coach for the US Paralympic swim team and advocate for accessible sports.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: Kelsey Hightower (born 1987) is an open source software developer and cloud architect who cofounded the Kelsey Hightower Collective and Tide Pod Consulting Agency. Kelsey joined Google in 2010 before transferring to Amazon in 2014. There, he spearheaded developer evangelism efforts around Kubernetes and the Amazon Web Service (AWS), helping drive the widespread adoption of the open source technology. He served as director of Kubernetes at Google in 2021.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: MacKenzie Scott (born 1987) is an American fashion designer. She took her first job in fashion after studying at the Rhode Island School of Design, joining Diane von Furstenberg's design team at age 21. While at DVF, she designed jumpsuits. While also designing for Ralph Lauren, Scott created her own label, Bode. After working as a consultant, she began producing jumpsuits under the Bode moniker. Her work has been praised by celebrities, including Lady Gaga and Gigi Hadid. Scott is also known for her activism, launching the #ThisBijouxIsMe campaign and a T-shirt line to raise awareness for the gender pay gap. Scott's jumpsuits have a cult following.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: Mackenzie Scott (born 1995), also known as Sharon Clute, is an American singer, songwriter, and record producer. She is best known as the lead singer and songwriter for the indie pop band Hundred Waters. The group's 2016 single "Show Me Love" garnered widespread acclaim for its mashup of pop, jazz, and hip-hop. In 2017, Scott announced her debut album, The Root, which released the following year to positive reviews. She has also released solo music as Sharon Clute, most notably with the albums No Vision (2019) and Black Gap (2022).

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: Mackenzie Lueck (1997-2019) was a Utah college student and Air Force reservist who disappeared in June 2019. Lueck, a native of Ellicott City, Maryland, was studying at Salt Lake City Community College. Friends reported her missing when she failed to make a return flight from California to Salt Lake City. Investigators discovered evidence of a sexual encounter in the park. Lueck's body was found burned in a Utah canyon. A suspect, Michael Whiting, was arrested and accused of her murder.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: Born into a California tech family in 1993, Mackenzie Lueck became an academic at Stanford University and studied cognitive sciences. Lured into cryptocurrency in 2013, soon launched blockchain startup Moot, which would later be called Circle. Circle was acquired by Coinbase for over $400 million in 2018, as Lueck was catapulted to one of the leading lights of fintech. She stepped down from Coinbase in 2019 to launch blockchain advocacy group Decrypting Crypto, and continues to appear on TV and in news publications as something of a crypto crusader. Lueck is also active in politics, endorsing and donating to candidates like Bernie Sanders.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: MacKenzie Scott (born 1973), known professionally as Mackenzie Foy, is an American actress and model. She is most well-known for her role as Renesmee Cullen in The Twilight Saga films. Foy also starred in The Conjuring 2. Offscreen, she was involved in the anti-smoking campaign Truth Initiative. Foy later became a United Nations Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations Development Programme and UN Women. In 2018, Foy donated $30,000 to Democratic congresswoman Lauren Underwood's campaign.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: MacKenzie Scott (born 1993) is an American model. Scott was the first woman to walk in the annual Victoria's Secret Fashion Show in 2017. She has walked in the VSFS every year since. The 2022 VSFS was Scott's last after she reported she no longer wished to be a model in an open letter and a social media post.

input: Write a short biography of MacKenzie Scott.
output: MacKenzie Scott (born 1960) is an American billionaire heiress and philanthropist for anti-capitalist causes. She was formerly CEO of the fashion company Liz Claiborne, and is daughter of the late billionaire and philanthropist J. Howard Pew. After stepping down from the family foundation in 2012, Scott spent two years in a Buddhist monastery. In 2014, she settled in the Tetons, Wyoming, where her property includes a Buddhist monastery, a retirement home for exiled Tibetan monks, and a sanctuary for wolves. A self-identified "wolf woman," Scott has attracted national attention for her efforts to protect and study wolves.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys, (born 1997) is an American retired professional tennis player. She won her first WTA singles title in 2015 and the 2018 US Open. At the 2019 Wimbledon she advanced to the championship match, where she lost to Angelique Kerber. During her 10-year career, Madison Keys won 10 WTA singles titles and a silver medal in the 2016 Olympics. Keys retired from play in 2020.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1997) is a professional tennis player. She has won three WTA singles titles and reached No. 10 in the world rankings. Keys made her Grand Slam debut at 17 and competed at the 2014 Australian Open, winning over four ranked opponents before losing to Serena Williams. She reached the quarterfinals of the Australian Open three times from 2016-2020. She was the runner-up of the 2018 US Open, before her first Grand Slam singles title in 2021.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is an American tennis player who won the 2017 US Open and was ranked world No. 5. Originally from the Bronx, she moved to Florida in third grade where she began playing tennis. Keys has won three Olympic medals, two Australian Open titles and a WTA Masters Series. She has teamed up with sister Madison Keys to make it to the US Open doubles final in 2014. She was diagnosed with Epstein-Barr virus in 2018, and her comeback inspired the sports world.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is a tennis player from Buffalo, New York. She won silver at the 2016 Olympics in Rio. She is currently seventh in the world and has reached the finals at Wimbledon and the U.S. Open. Keys enjoys fishing and collecting art from New York City's Bowery district. Her great-grandfather, a Russian Jewish immigrant, founded National Food, the company that makes Krispy Kreme doughnuts and Otis Spunkmeyer muffins.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is an American tennis player. She has been ranked as high as 7 in the World and won the US Open and Australian Open doubles championships. Keys became the youngest American to reach a singles semifinal at the US Open when she did it in 2014. She has won multiple Fed Cups for the United States. Her older brother, Stephen, is a professional ice hockey player.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is a professional tennis player from the United States. She rose through the ITF junior rankings, and was the top junior when she turned pro in 2012. She won the U.S. Open Junior Doubles Championship in 2012, and reached the U.S. Open semifinals as a teenager in 2014. She finished 2016 as the world's top-ranking American. Keys has reached three grand slam quarterfinals, including the semifinals at Wimbledon in 2018. She missed large chunks of 2019 due to injuries, finishing outside the top 100 for the first time.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is an American tennis player. Ranked fifth in the world as a teenager, she has won two singles titles on the WTA Tour and made three Grand Slam finals, including the US Open in 2017. Keys played at Wimbledon as a teenager, reaching the quarterfinals, and competed at the Olympics but has not won a major title. She has three gold medals at the Fed Cup, including the 2017 team championship, and has served as captain of the US team since 2019.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1997) is an American professional tennis player. Hailing from New York, Keys trains at the Bolletieri Academy in Bradenton, Florida. She first gained attention in 2012, defeating Serena Williams and Simona Halep. Keys was the first American female to earn a singles medal (bronze) at the 2016 Olympic Games. She has also had success on the WTA Tour, reaching two Grand Slams finals and winning 11 career titles. While ranked top-ten, Keys was a WTA Finals doubles winner. Her 2020 season, including a US Open semifinal and a French Open quarterfinal, earned her the WTA World No. 4 ranking.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is an American professional tennis player. The 21-year-old was a top junior player, beating both Serena and Venus Williams. Keys won her first WTA title in 2016, the first American in six years to do so. She reached the US Open women's championship and WTA Finals this year. At the French Open, she reached the quarterfinals and played her way back into the Top 10.

input: Write a short biography of Madison Keys.
output: Madison Keys (born 1995) is an American tennis player, and the highest-ranked American woman. Keys won her first professional title in 2013. She rose to prominence in 2015 with wins over top players at the Australian Open, Wimbledon, the Bank of the West Classic, and the Sony Open. After suffering an injury in 2018, she returned in 2019 and won a total of nine titles in singles and doubles. She has won the Australian Open, Wimbledon, the French Open, and the US Open in singles, as well as the US Open in doubles.

input: Write a short biography of Madonna.
output: Madonna (born 1958) is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and entrepreneur. She began performing in nightclubs as a teenager, developing a high camp style that combined rock and pop music with elements of classical music. She became a pop icon in the 1980s, and gained even greater popularity in the 1990s, breaking down barriers as one of the first female solo pop stars. input: Write a short biography of Martin Luther King Jr..

input: Write a short biography of Mary Wollstonecraft.
output: Mary Wollstonecraft (1759-1797) was a British writer, activist, and feminist. She was expelled from school for having a child out of wedlock, leaving the woman unmarried at age 17. Thereafter, he painted his largest work, the Sistine Chapel ceiling, before turning to marble sculpture. He created the biblical heroes, David, Jonathan, and the Prophet Jeremiah. Appearing in films like St. Elmo's Fire, Dangerous Beauty, and Children of the Revolution, she emerged as a leading lady in D-List movies. Later roles include the title role in King Kong and the Oscar-winning The Impossible. Recent films include 9/11 and The Book of Life.

input: Write a short biography of Naomi Watts.
output: Naomi Watts (born 1968) is a British-Australian film actor, known for roles in movies such as The Ring, Mulholland Drive, and 21 Grams. Watts began her acting career in London in commercials and television shows. She later moved to New York, where her roles in movies such as Dangerous Liaisons and Mulholland Drive brought her attention. Watts won her first Primetime Emmy in 2018. She has been married to actor Liev Schreiber since 2007 and they have two children together.

input: Write a short biography of Naomi Watts.
output: Naomi Watts (born 1968) is an Australian actress of British descent. Her father was a sound engineer; her mother was a fashion merchandiser. She made her debut in Kingpin (1996) and the TV series Home and Away. Her breakthrough role on the big screen was in David Lynch's Mulholland Drive. Watts has since acted in films with major directors such as Peter Jackson, David O. Russell and Christopher Nolan. She was a recurring star on the Netflix drama series Gypsy and recently appeared in The Wolf Hour.

input: Write a short biography of Naomi Watts.
output: Naomi Watts (born 1968) is a British-Australian actress and producer. She is a two-time Oscar nominee for performances in King Kong (2005) and Two Girls and a Guy (1998). She won three Golden Globes and three Screen Actors Guild Awards. Watts was nominated for six Emmy Awards for her work on HBO's East of Eden and Game of Thrones. Among her other top films are Mulholland Drive (2001), Remember (2015), The Impossible (2012), and Diana (2013).

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) plays center for the Colorado Avalanche of the National Hockey League. After playing for his junior team, he was selected first overall in the 2013 NHL Draft. MacKinnon made his NHL debut for the Avalanche in 2013-14 and finished second in rookie of the year voting. He was the first player in NHL history to score a hat trick in fewer than 2 minutes. MacKinnon won the Art Ross Trophy as the league's top scorer in both 2017-18 and 2018-19, and the Maurice "Rocket" Richard Trophy as the league's leading goal scorer in 2018-19 and 2019-20. In December 2021, MacKinnon joined the Florida Panthers, for whom he debuted the following month. An MVP candidate, MacKinnon is considered one of the best and most complete players in the league.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1997) is a Canadian-American professional ice hockey player for the Colorado Avalanche. A first round pick in 2013, MacKinnon leads his team in nearly every statistical category, was named MVP of the 2013 draft, and has won the Calder Trophy as rookie of the year twice. MacKinnon has won two Stanley Cups, including MVP honors in 2019. A three time Hart Trophy finalist, he has scored at least 40 goals in a season four times and won the Art Ross Trophy twice as the league's top points scorer, making him one of the most dominant NHL players of this generation. An Olympic gold medalist, MacKinnon has represented Canada, the United States, and Denmark in international competition and was named a league All-Star 10 times.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a professional hockey player and center for Colorado Avalanche. MacKinnon was drafted to the Avalanche with the overall number one pick in the 2013 NHL draft, playing with the Avs ever since. In high school, MacKinnon excelled in sports and academics before joining the Halifax Mooseheads of the QMJHL in 2011. Selected second overall in the 2012 NHL draft, MacKinnon made his National Hockey League debut in 2013 and led the Avs in the 2013–14 season. A fan favorite, MacKinnon has won numerous individual awards and was named an NHL All-Star Game MVP in 2018 and 2020.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a Canadian professional hockey player who plays for the Florida Panthers of the NHL. A standout player from the Avalanche organizations, he has won two Calder Trophies as the league's top rookie and received the league's MVP award in 2019. He won a Stanley Cup as captain of the Avalanche in 2021.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is an ice hockey winger who plays for the Colorado Avalanche. Selected first overall by the Avs in 2013, MacKinnon was named the rookie of the year and won the Calder (top rookie) in 2013. The 2013-14 season also saw MacKinnon named to the All-Star team, and he has been in the All-Star game in four of his first six seasons. The 2019-2020 season saw MacKinnon win the Hart (MVP) and Art Ross (scoring champion) trophies, the first player to do so since Mario Lemieux in 1993.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a Canadian professional ice hockey player and captain of the Colorado Avalanche. He was awarded the Ted Lindsay Award in 2014 after leading the NHL in total goals. MacKinnon began his career with the Halifax Mooseheads and signed with the Avalanche in 2013. In 2019, he was named the MVP of the NHL.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a Canadian professional hockey player and captain of the Colorado Avalanche of the NHL. Playing for the Halifax Mooseheads, he led the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League with 58 goals in 2012-13. The Avalanche selected MacKinnon first overall in the 2013 NHL draft. He won the Hart Trophy in 2019 and 2021 as the league's MVP, two Art Ross Trophies for most points and a Conn Smyth Trophy for the playoffs' Most Valuable Player. MacKinnon is a two-time Olympic gold medalist and has won two World Championships with Canada.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a Canadian professional ice hockey player for the Avalanche and captain of the Canadian national team. MacKinnon was selected first overall in the NHL draft in 2013 after leading the Halifax Mooseheads in scoring. He won the Calder Trophy in 2014 as Rookie of the Year. After signing with the Avalanche in 2013, MacKinnon has become one of the League's most prolific scorers, leading the league in points and winning the Art Ross Trophy in 2018-19. His three-goal game in the Stanley Cup finals in 2019 contributed to the Avalanche winning their first Stanley Cup.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a Canadian ice hockey player who currently plays for the Colorado Avalanche of the NHL. MacKinnon won gold at the 2019 World Junior Championship and was the league's top scorer in 2018, 2019, and 2020. A two-time NHL All-Star, MacKinnon has been a vital part of the Avalanche's run to three Stanley Cup finals. He also played on Canada's 2021 silver medal-winning team. MacKinnon was selected sixth overall by the Avalanche in the 2013 NHL draft at age 18.

input: Write a short biography of Nathan MacKinnon.
output: Nathan MacKinnon (born 1995) is a Canadian professional hockey player who has won the Art Ross and Hart Trophies. MacKinnon has played most of his career with the Colorado Avalanche. He won the Hart Trophy as MVP in 2018-19. MacKinnon won the Stanley Cup with the Avs in 2020. As a junior with the Halifax Mooseheads, MacKinnon led the league in scoring in both his last two seasons. In the 2013 NHL Draft, MacKinnon was picked first overall by the Avs.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was one of just 12 men to set foot on the surface of the Moon. As the commander of Apollo 11 in 1969, Armstrong became the first human ever to do so, uttering the famous words, "One small step for man, one giant leap for mankind." The 24th of 14 children, Armstrong grew up in modest circumstances, enlisting in the military when he left school. He earned a bachelor's degree in aeronautical engineering and later served in the Korean War and later as a test pilot. He became a NASA astronaut in 1962, undergoing four launchpad test flights.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was the first human to set foot on the Moon and an aeronautical research pilot in the 1960s. As commander of Apollo 11, Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed on the Moon on July 20, 1969. They spent 21 hours and 31 minutes there before liftoff. The mission ushered in a new era of space exploration and led to further joint United States-Soviet space missions. Armstrong received the Congressional Gold Medal in 2009. In October 2012, he was the oldest and last surviving crew member of the Apollo missions.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was an American astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon during the Apollo 11 mission in 1969. He grew up in Ohio and served as a naval officer before pursuing an education in aeronautical engineering. As a test pilot, Armstrong helped design the Gemini spacecraft, which led to his selection as an astronaut for Apollo 8 and 11. He spent 2½ hours outside his spacecraft during the historic Moon landing in July 1969. Armstrong flew again in 1971 but left NASA in 1971. After teaching aeronautical engineering, Armstrong joined the faculty at Ohio State University and wrote several books. He died of complications from heart surgery in 2012.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was an American astronaut and the first man to walk on the Moon as part of the Apollo 11 mission. After serving as a navy fighter pilot during the Korean War, he became a test pilot and began working for NASA in 1962 when they selected him for Project Mercury. Armstrong commanded Gemini 8 in 1966 and Apollo 11 in 1969, the first American Moon landing. Following his time in space, Armstrong taught university courses, served on corporate boards, and promoted aviation in the US and China.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was the first man to set foot on the moon in 1969. A veteran of the Korean War, he left the Navy to become a civilian test pilot, including serving in NASA's Astronaut Corps. In 1968, he commanded Gemini 8, a spacewalk mission. Armstrong was the commander of Apollo 11, piloting the first lunar module to the Moon. He died in 2012 of heart failure.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Alden Armstrong (1930-2012) was an American astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon. A naval aviator, Armstrong flew about 2,000 hours in combat and commanded a carrier-based jet squadron in the Korean War. Following a career with NASA and a brief stint as an aerospace test pilot, Armstrong became an instructor pilot for the U.S. Air Force. In 1968, NASA selected the 38-year-old Armstrong for the Gemini 8 mission. In 1969, he flew in Apollo 11, landing the first Moonwalk during Apollo 11. After leaving NASA, Armstrong taught aeronautics and flew for other aerospace companies.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930 - 2012) was a NASA astronaut and the first human to walk on the Moon. He became an astronaut in 1962 and was in space on six Gemini missions before going to the Moon on the Apollo 11 mission in 1969. Armstrong descended the ladder of the Apollo 11 craft, "one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind" and proclaimed a hope for "peace for all mankind." He spent two and a half hours on the Moon and returned to Earth on Apollo 11.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Arthur Armstrong (1930-2012) was an American astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon. Born in Ohio, Armstrong enlisted in the Navy in 1949 and became a naval aviator. In the 1950s, he helped test the X-15. Armstrong left NASA to work at Edwards Air Force Base and Wright-Patterson Air Force Base. He was named pilot for Apollo 11 and flew the first manned spacecraft to land on the Moon. Armstrong received the Presidential Medal of Freedom before returning home to his farm in Ohio. He left the armed forces as a commander and died in Cincinnati.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was the first astronaut on the Moon. A naval aviator, test pilot and aeronautical engineer, he became a professor of aeronautical engineering at the University of Cincinnati before joining the U.S. Naval Research Laboratory in 1962. When NASA established its mission to the Moon, Armstrong was among the first group of astronauts chosen by the organization. He flew into space twice: aboard Gemini VIII in 1966 and Apollo 11 in 1969. Following his return to space during the 1971-72 Apollo missions, Armstrong resigned from NASA and became a visiting professor at the University of Cincinnati. He is known for the phrase "That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind" after stepping on the Moon. Armstrong's death was related to complications from cardiovascular surgery. He was buried at sea in the Atlantic Ocean.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Armstrong.
output: Neil Armstrong (1930-2012) was an astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon during Apollo 11. Born in Ohio, he flew combat missions during the Korean War before studying aeronautical engineering at Purdue University. He started a job at NACA, NASA's pre-Civil Rights organization, but his military experience was rejected several times. He was eventually accepted into the US Air Force as a test pilot, and was selected for the Gemini program in 1962. In 1968, Apollo 8 became the first spacecraft to orbit another celestial body. Armstrong commanded Apollo 11, and was the first to descend to the lunar surface in 1969. The following year, he resigned from NASA. Armstrong died in 2012.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and guitarist. After a brief early career in folk, he joined Buffalo Springfield and the band went on to be one of the most influential groups in Canadian rock music. Young then went on to form legendary rock outfit Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young. His work with Buffalo Springfield, Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, the L.A. Express, the Stray Gators, and Crazy Horse has influenced generations of artists like Nirvana, Pearl Jam, and Weezer. In 1988, Young was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, and Rolling Stone ranks Young second behind Bob Dylan and ahead of The Beatles, on their list of the "100 Greatest Artists of All Time".

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a Canadian rock legend, known for his work with Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young and his solo career. As a teenager, he performed with a series of bands. Young founded Buffalo Springfield and Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, a popular 1970s group. Young became a solo artist in the 1970s, with several albums like "Harvest," "After the Gold Rush," and "Neil Young & Crazy Horse." "Harvest" includes the Grammy-winning song "Heart of Gold." Young also pursues social issues through his music and philanthropy. He has sold over 70 million records worldwide.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a prolific singer, songwriter, and guitarist. He co-founded the rock band Buffalo Springfield in 1966 and has recorded and released over 50 albums as a solo artist. Young was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1995. He has received various honors for his work and is regarded as one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a musician and activist. Active since the 1960s, Young created the ground-breaking band Buffalo Springfield. He later fronted the folk-rock act Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young. Young released his first solo album in 1968. His catalogue contains over 50 critically-acclaimed solo records and dozens more with CSNY. Young has been the subject of numerous biographies and documentaries. He has been inducted into the Rock and Roll and Songwriters Hall of Fame, and is ranked #22 on Rolling Stone magazine's list of the 100 Greatest Artists of All Time.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a Canadian singer, songwriter, guitarist, and activist. Young entered the music scene in the late 1960s as co-founder of Buffalo Springfield, then released his debut solo album in 1968. Known for his high vocal range and distinctive guitar playing, Young's work spans the genres of folk, country, rock, and experimental. He has been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, received a lifetime achievement Grammy, and recorded over 30 studio albums. Young also founded the organization Bridge School, which provides education for disabled children, and plays charity concerts to advance its mission.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a Canadian singer-songwriter, musician, composer, and humanitarian. Young founded the rock band Buffalo Springfield in the 1960s. His solo music is considered rock, folk, and country, and includes works such as "Harvest Moon," "Cinnamon Girl," and "Heart of Gold." Young has supported a diverse range of social and political causes. He was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1995.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is an American singer, songwriter, and musician known for his signature baritone voice. A legendary musician, Young recorded his first single for the Squires in 1964, while still in high school. He became a founding member of Buffalo Springfield later that year before founding Crazy Horse and releasing the landmark album _Everybody Knows This Is Nowhere._ Young went on to record several solo albums, often focusing on socially conscious folk music. Along with Crosby, Stills & Nash he formed CSNY. He is also a member of folk rock supergroup CSN, and plays in the Americana band Promise of the Real. Young has been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame twice, as part of Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, and as a solo artist.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a Canadian musician, songwriter, and activist. In the 1960s, he founded Buffalo Springfield and Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young before becoming a solo artist. Young has released dozens of albums and won a Grammy for his folk album Harvest. He has collaborated with various musicians, including the Pretenders, Tom Petty, and The Heartbreakers. In addition to his music, Young has devoted his life to causes ranging from environmental issues to education reform, donating millions of dollars to such causes. Young has been the subject of films, documentaries, and books.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and musician. Young co-founded the bands Buffalo Springfield and Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young with Stephen Stills. A prolific singer-songwriter, he has released over thirty albums and produced a string of hit songs. Young's music evolved from ragged folk to soft rock with the Heart of Gold and Harvest periods, before settling on country-influenced rock and roll in the mid-1970s. Favorite songs include "Wonderin'," "Heart of Gold," "Long May You Run." Young has received a number of honors throughout his career, including a Governor General's Performing Arts Award and Kennedy Center Honors, and has been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame twice.

input: Write a short biography of Neil Young.
output: Neil Young (born 1945) is a musician, most famed for his solo work and the rock bands the Buffalo Springfield and Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young. input: Write a short biography of Nelson Mandela.
output: Nelson Mandela (1918-2013) was the first President of South Africa after the abolition of apartheid, serving 1994-1999. He came to prominence as leader of the African National Congress, and spent 27 years in prison for opposing apartheid. Mandela founded the ruling ANC Youth League in 1944. After his release from prison, he joined the ANC National Executive Committee, then the Liberation Committee, and ultimately served as the national leader of the ANC. He became involved in a militant wing of the ANC, and served 27 years in prison.

input: Write a short biography of Nelson Mandela.
output: Nelson Mandela (1918-2013) was a South African anti-apartheid leader who became president of the country in 1994, ending apartheid and ushering in democratic rule. Born in 1918 into a royal lineage in the Transkei, Mandela was expelled from high school for organizing student boycotts and joining the African National Congress, or ANC, in 1944. Arrested 17 times, he led the ANC's 1960-61 Defiance Campaign against unjust laws. In 1963, Mandela was sentenced to 27 years in prison for "sabotage" against the government. After his release in 1990, he and the ANC won South Africa's first multiracial elections. A committed pacifist, Mandela believed in peaceful opposition and refused to seek revenge against those who jailed him for 27 years. He became the first black president of South Africa in 1994 and stepped down after one term. He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993

input: Write a short biography of Nelson Mandela.
output: Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela (1918-2013) was an anti-apartheid activist and South Africa's first democratically-elected president from 1994-1999. He spent 27 years in prison, including 18 on Robben Island. After his release, Mandela founded the ANC, serving as the organization's leader until 1991. In 1994, Mandela was elected president under the ANC's banner. He sought to redistribute wealth and promote reconciliation, leading his nation through a 3-year transition to democracy. Mandela's long-time leadership of the ANC earned him the title "Father of the Nation." Mandela died of a respiratory infection at age 95.

input: Write a short biography of Nelson Mandela.
output: Nelson Mandela (1918-2013) was a South African politician and activist who led the fight against apartheid and won South Africa's first free elections in 1994. He served as President of South Africa from 1994-1999. Born in a rural area of the Transkei region, Mandela was a political activist in the African National Congress from an early age. After 27 years in prison, he was released in 1990. He traveled the world, campaigning for the end of apartheid. After leaving the presidency, he pursued various philanthropic and cultural projects. He passed away from a respiratory infection in 2013.

input: Write a short biography of Nelson Mandela.
output: Nelson Mandela (1918-2013) was a South African antiapartheid activist, lawyer and politician. He served as President of South Africa from 1994-1999. While imprisoned on Robben Island for 27 years, Mandela became an international symbol of resistance to racial oppression. He was convicted in 1963 on charges of sabotage and conspiracy, though he was acquitted in 1964. Arrested again in 1963, he spent his time in jail writing and organizing antiapartheid campaigns. Upon his release, Mandela was banned from politics, but he continued to agitate for social change, serving as President of the African National Congress from 1990-97. He received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993.

input: Write a short biography of Nick Kyrgios.
output: Nick Kyrgios (born 1995) is an Australian professional tennis player. As a junior, Kyrgios was a top-ranked ITF junior, winning tournaments like the 2012 Wimbledon championships and 2012 Australian Open Championships. In 2012, he became the youngest ATP World Tour Finals participant and the only player born in the 1990s to reach the main draw. In 2013, Kyrgios became the youngest player to beat a Top-25 player and the first Australian male to reach the fourth round at the French Open since Pat Cash in 1987. He has won two ATP 250 tournaments, including a career-best win over Rafael Nadal. Kyrgios was ranked as high as 23rd in 2015 and has competed on the Australian Davis Cup team. He has been criticized for his poor behavior and lack of focus, and he has been suspended from the tour multiple times.

input: Write a short biography of Nikola Tesla.

input: Write a short biography of Nikola Tesla.

input: Write a short biography of Nikola Tesla.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka (Nee-KA) Ogwumike (born 1988) is a professional American women's basketball player with the Los Angeles Sparks in the WNBA. Nneka attended Stanford and then the University of Southern California, where she became the second freshman ever to be drafted. The WNBA drafted her 1st in 2012. Nneka helped Stanford win two national championships and made four All-American teams. She helped the US win gold at the 2010 World Championships and won gold with them at the 2018 World Cup. She's 1 of 4 people of Nigerian ancestry to win Olympic gold.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1989) is a Nigerian-American professional basketball player, captain of the WNBA's Los Angeles Sparks, and former member of the USA women's national team. She has won Olympic gold medals and other international tournaments, and she was the 2014 MVP in the WNBA. Nneka's father Sunday played in the NBA, helping the Lakers to two championships. Nneka and her twin sister Chiney also played high school basketball together.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1988) is a former professional basketball player for the Los Angeles Sparks of the WNBA. She was named WNBA rookie of the year in 2013 after leading Stanford to a national championship. As a junior and senior, she earned All-American honors, leading the Cardinal to two more Final Four appearances. Nneka's brothers, Abu and Amar'e, are also WNBA players. They are the first brother trio in WNBA history. The Ogwumikes were born in Enugu. Their father, Pops, played professional basketball in Nigeria. Nneka is married to NBA star Enes Kanter, with whom she has a daughter.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Ogwumike is a 6-foot-2, three-time WNBA champion who has spent her entire nine-year career with the Los Angeles Sparks. She is the daughter of Nigerian parents who immigrated to the United States. Ogwumike was named a Western Conference All-Star in her first two seasons and won the WNBA Finals MVP in 2021. Ogwumike became the first African-American woman to be inducted to the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in 2022. She played college basketball for Stanford, helping the Cardinal win the 2008 NCAA women's basketball championship.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1987) is a WNBA veteran forward. She was the number one pick in the 2008 draft. Nneka led Stanford to the national championship game three times, winning the title in 2008. She played in the US national teams from 2008 to 2016. Ogwumike played in the WNBA from 2009-2021, including a title with the Sparks in 2020, and was selected to the All-Star 10 times. A two-time Olympic medallist, Nneka finished sixth in scoring in WNBA history and 14th in rebounding.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1989), commonly known as "Nicki," is an American professional basketball player and Olympian. Ogwumike was a standout at Stanford University, where she was twice named most outstanding collegiate player. In 2016, she was selected as a reserve by the USA Women. In the 2016 Olympics, she won her third gold medal in women's basketball. Ogwumike has helped the United States win three straight world championships and is on track to win a fourth in 2020.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1988) is a WNBA forward for the Los Angeles Sparks. She is the second most prolific scorer in Sparks history. Drafted 14th overall in 2012, she won Rookie of the Year and made five all-star teams. Ogwumike led the Sparks to the 2021 WNBA Finals and her third MVP award.

input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1988) is a women's basketball player from the United States. She was the number 1 pick in the WNBA draft and played six seasons at Stanford before joining the Los Angeles Sparks. A multiple-time All-American, Ogwumike helped her team win WNBA championships in 2016 and 2020. She was WNBA Finals MVP for the 2021 season. input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
output: Nneka Ogwumike (born 1989) is a professional basketball player who has won four WNBA titles and led the league in rebounding, blocks, and scoring. She played college basketball at Stanford University, becoming the all-time leading scorer in the Pac-12 and leading the team to three NCAA championships. input: Write a short biography of Nneka Ogwumike.
