input: Write a short biography of Will Smith.
output: Willard Carroll "Will" Smith Jr. (born 1968) is an actor, producer, and rapper. He became a major star in the 1990s, best-known for portraying a diverse range of roles and for his hits such as "Men in Black," "Summertime," and "Wild Wild West." He is the highest-paid actor in the world. Smith formed a hip-hop duo with friend DJ Jazzy Jeff. He starred in blockbusters "Independence Day," "Men in Black," and "Ali," and won Oscars for his role in "The Pursuit of Happyness." In 2019, he founded a streaming service called Quibi. He is a board member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was a renowned English playwright, poet, and actor. Shakespeare's work is widely read throughout the world. Influential plays such as "Hamlet," "Macbeth," and "Romeo and Juliet" explore the nature of humanity. "As You Like It," "A Midsummer Night's Dream," and "Twelfth Night" are among his best-loved comedies. Shakespeare also wrote 38 sonnets, one of the most famous poetic collections in English literature. Aged 32, he retired to Stratford, raising a family in a quiet suburb. Today, his Birthplace and Halls of Fame preserve the site of his childhood home.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English poet and playwright, widely considered the greatest writer in the English language. He wrote over 38 plays between 1589 and 1613, including classics like _Macbeth_ and _Romeo and Juliet_. He was also credited with inventing over 2,000 idioms and catch phrases. Shakespeare famously used 17,000 unique words in his work, a staggering 14% of the English language.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English playwright and actor who is widely regarded as the greatest European writer in history. Born to a local politician and a mother of good standing, Shakespeare grew up in an affluent neighborhood and married the daughter of a successful landowner. He worked as a tutor and an actor in London's theatrical scene, and quickly became a popular writer and playwright. In 1578, Shakespeare established the successful Globe Theatre and built London's theatrical scene into a huge enterprise. Among his best-known dramas are _Macbeth_, _Hamlet_, _Antony and Cleopatra_, _Romeo and Juliet_, and _King Lear_. He retired from acting to focus on writing in 1613. Over 400 years after his death, Shakespeare still ranks as the most-performed playwright in world history and is the most-quoted writer in history.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English writer who is widely considered the greatest playwright and poet in the English language. He wrote numerous plays and sonnets, as well as poems published in several major collections. After beginning his career in London, Shakespeare joined the prestigious company of the Lord Chamberlain's Men the following decade. In 23 seasons, his company produced 37 plays, along with another 154 of which he was the principal writer. Many of his works, including Hamlet, Macbeth, and Romeo and Juliet, serve as the basis for modern works of literature.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) is regarded as the greatest and most influential writer in English literature. He is famous for plays such as Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet and Macbeth, as well as his famous sonnets. After studying at University of Stratford, Shakespeare worked as an actor before establishing his career in London as a playwright.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English playwright and poet whose works have been translated into every major language. His plays include Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet and Twelfth Night (or What You Will). Shakespeare also wrote a number of sonnets, often addressed to the beautiful young Venus and the lovesick youth Adonis. Shakespeare's works are among the greatest in the English language. As one of the world's most-quoted writers, the Bard has influenced writers from Ernest Hemingway to Toni Morrison.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English poet, playwright, and actor active in the late sixteenth and early seventeenth centuries. He wrote the 154 plays and 154 sonnets that are credited to him. Shakespeare was among the most prolific writers in the English language, and his works have had a profound impact on culture throughout the world. He is widely considered the preeminent dramatist of his time.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English writer and one of the world's most famous playwrights. His best known plays include Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet, and Macbeth. Shakespeare also wrote 154 sonnets and dozens of poems and shorter pieces. In addition to his literary output he was an actor and theater company manager. Shakespeare is widely regarded as the greatest English-language writer ever. He is the only writer to have a memorial in Westminster Abbey, a feat given to no other writer before or since.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English poet, playwright, and actor of the Elizabethan Age. Considered the greatest writer in English literature, he penned a number of plays, including Hamlet and Macbeth, alongside his sonnets and poems. Shakespeare wrote over 37 plays, most notably at the Globe Theater. In addition to his literary achievements, Shakespeare also acted at the Globe Theater by the Bank of England in London. Shakespeare continued to write a few years after his death and died on April 23, 1616, at the age of 52.

input: Write a short biography of William Shakespeare.
output: William Shakespeare (1564-1616) was an English writer, known as the preeminent playwright in the English language. He is often credited with popularizing the modern English language through use of iambic pentameter and regular rhyming. Shakespeare wrote plays such as *Romeo and Juliet* and "Hamlet," and composed over 150 poems, which have also become popular for their use of metaphor and imagery.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Churchill.
output: Winston Churchill (1874-1965) was a British politician who served as Prime Minister from 1940-1945 and again from 1951-1955. Born into the aristocratic Churchill family, he studied at Harrow and Oxford before his political career. He entered the Conservative Party, serving as Chancellor of the Exchequer during the First World War. Churchill is best known for leading Britain during World War II, which ended in victory and later became the foundation of the British Commonwealth. His oratory, leadership, and iconic status made him one of the most celebrated statesmen of the 20th century.

output: Winston Churchill (1874-1965) was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1940-1945 and from 1951-1955. During World War I, he helped lead the Gallipoli campaign, which was unsuccessful. He later became a vocal opponent of Britain's involvement in the conflict. Churchill's opposition to Neville Chamberlain's policy of appeasement brought him to power in 1940, when he led the United Kingdom during the Blitz. input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Ghanaian-Puerto Rican actor and musician. After training at HB Studio in New York, Duke appeared in plays and smaller films. His feature debut was as Ant in Black Panther (2018). He starred as Andre in Us (2019), a thriller by director Jordan Peele which was a global box-office success. Duke has been called "the coolest brother on the planet" for playing two roles in Us, his charismatic appearance, and his musical talent as the lead singer of the musical comedy group the Hot Mess.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Jamaican-born American actor, best known for his performances in Black Panther, Us, and Jumanji: The Next Level. He first gained attention for his role in the acclaimed drama Mudbound (2017). Duke was born in Kingston, Jamaica, and grew up in New York City. After studying literature and creative writing at the University of Miami, Duke turned to acting. In 2021, he was named People magazine's "Sexiest Man Alive."

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Guyanese-American actor and rapper. He made his acting debut with a small role in _Chronicle_ and his first major studio role in American Assassin, followed by other major supporting roles in Becoming Jane, Black Panther, and Star Wars: The Last Jedi. Duke went on to originate the role of M'Baku in Black Panther, its sequel MCU: Captain America: Civil War, and a Disney+ prequel, Black Panther: Wakanda Forever. Duke's breakout role came as the lead of Jordan Peele's Oscar-nominated horror film, Us.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Jamaican–American actor and comedian. He first pursued a career in music before moving to New York City to pursue acting. After taking classes at the William Esper Studio, he booked his first commercials and TV roles, including in "Nurse Jackie" and "Person of Interest." Duke gained prominence playing M'Baku, a superhero antagonist in Black Panther (2018). He made his English-language debut in "Godzilla: King of the Monsters" (2019) and returned to the franchise in 2021 "Godzilla vs. Kong." Other feature film credits include "Us" (2019) and The Suicide Squad" (2022). Writer-director Ryan Coogler cast Duke as a lead in his crime drama "Wrong Answer," and Duke made his feature directorial debut with his autobiographical short, "Above."

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Jamaican actor and model. Duke first appeared on the small screen in 2013 on Netflix's Orange Is the New Black. He has since landed lead roles in Netflix's She's Gotta Have It, HBO's Girls, and the 2019 remake of Child's Play, playing the main villain. Duke is also known for his role in Jordan Peele's Oscar-winning horror film, Us.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Jamaican-American actor and musician. After studying music at Berklee College of Music, Duke moved to New York. He played basketball professionally in Germany before acting in theater and later film. Widely recognized as a horror actor for his work in horror films, he also portrayed Shaka Zulu in the movie Black Panther. His film Black and Blue (2019) had a record debut weekend for a superhero film and received a nomination for Best Acting Ensemble.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986), also known as Winston Duke Mingiesi, is a Panamanian-Guyanese actor featured in American series and films such as Black Panther and Child's Play. Born in the District of Columbia, Duke began acting while a student at the University of Illinois. He made his film debut in Jordan Vogt-Roberts' horror comedy The Final Girls. Duke went on to work in television on AMC's Halt and Catch Fire and Netflix's Jessica Jones. After success in the horror movie Black Panther, Duke starred in the comedies Little, Child's Play and The Suicide Squad.

input: Write a short biography of Winston Duke.
output: Winston Duke (born 1986) is a Trinidadian-born American actor and model. A rising star, Duke gained notice after appearing in Netflix's hit comedies Get Out (2017) and Black Panther (2018). Duke went on to win both the Screen Actors Guild Award and the Critics' Choice Award for his leading role in the Showtime miniseries The Wire. He has since acted in the films Us (2019) and Jungle Cruise (2020). Duke is also a professional street basketball player who won the World Hoops Championship in 2016.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is a Ghanaian-American novelist and essayist. Her first novel, Homegoing, tells the story of the slave trade from the perspective of a single, extended Ghanaian family. The book was named one of The New York Times' Bests of 2016, winning the John Leonard Prize for debut fiction and the National Book Critics Circle's John Leonard Prize. She is the founder of Black Girl Reading, a non-profit that funds African book projects and publishes African writers.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is an American writer. She came from a Ghanaian family and grew up in Stone Mountain, Georgia. Gyasi was inspired by her grandfather to study Ghana's history after he told her that he grew up in a kingdom. Gyasi wrote her first novel Homegoing, based on the generational history of a family that begins in Ghana and ends in the United States. The book won the John Leonard Prize in 2016. Homegoing became a #1 New York Times bestseller and was adapted into a film by HBO.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is a Ghanaian-American novelist and author of the New York Times best-selling novel Homegoing. She grew up in Baltimore, Maryland, and studied at Stanford University and the Johns Hopkins Writing Seminars. She was inspired to write Homegoing after she and her family visited Ghana in 2009. Homegoing explores the tragedy of slavery and African colonization through the stories of eight generations of one family. Yaa Gyasi says, "I want my writing to create empathy for the humanity of people from other cultures and help humanize and demystify those cultures."

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is an award-winning Ghanaian-American novelist. She studied at Stanford University and was raised in Baltimore to immigrant parents from Ghana. Based in Brooklyn, Yaa has written two critically acclaimed novels: the bestselling debut "Homegoing" (2016), which interweaves family stories set in Ghana and the United States, and "Celia" (2021). A widely discussed novelist, Yaa Gyasi has been noted for her "vivid social history" and prose. Her work has been shortlisted for the Dayton Literary Peace Prize, Kiriyama Prize and Hurston/Wright Legacy Award.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is a Ghanaian-American novelist. Her debut novel, Homegoing, traced 300 years of African and African-American history from colonial Ghana through American slavery, the Black Power Movement, to the AIDS epidemic and beyond. Gyasi graduated from Stanford University. She is now an instructor at the Iowa Writers' Workshop and a fellow of the Lannan Center for Poetics and Social Practice.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is an African-American novelist whose debut novel, Homegoing (2016), was a finalist for the National Book Critic's Circle Award and the Baileys Women's Prize for Fiction. Homegoing tells the history of the same family for eight generations, beginning over 250 years of slavery in Ghana, and ending with an international family who escapes the trauma of slavery. Gyasi has lived in Ghana and studied at the University of California, Los Angeles. Her work is inspired by the history and cultures of Africa, the Caribbean, and the United States.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1989) is a Ghanaian-American writer best known for her first novel, Homegoing (2016). It follows a family descended from 18th-century Ghanaian royalty over eight generations. Yaa won a Rona Jaffe Writers' Award for the novel and the National Book Foundation's 5 Under 35 Award. Yaa's novel was translated into more than 20 languages.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (born 1980) is a Ghanaian writer of Ghanaian and African American heritage. She was born in Tema and raised between Accra, Ghana, and Huntsville, Alabama. Gyasi earned degrees in English at Stanford and the University of Iowa. Her first novel, Homegoing (2016), tells the interwoven stories of two siblings separated by the slave trade and follows seven generations of the Ghanaian Effia and Ghanaian Esi. It won the John Leonard Prize and an American Book Award.

input: Write a short biography of Yaa Gyasi.
output: Yaa Gyasi (Born 1989) is a Ghanaian-American author, known for her best-selling debut novel, Homegoing. The book follows one family through African diaspora and slavery to the time of Obama. Homegoing won the John Leonard Prize, and Yaa Gyasi was named 'Best New Author' by various US publication. Gyasi, who was born in New York, is an alumna of Stanford University.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese artist who works in several media. Influenced by Surrealism, abstract expressionism and pop art, Kusama explores philosophy and the meaning of life through her art, often collaborating with fashion brands. She worked as a painter and installation artist until 1967 when she was committed to a hospital due to mental health struggles. Kusama eventually moved to Los Angeles, where she collaborated with Andy Warhol on "Love Flies Out of the Window." Following Warhol's death, Kusama returned to Japan, where her career in art and fashion took off.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese artist who developed various "Infinity Rooms," psychedelic and neo-Surrealist paintings, furniture, and sculptures. Kusama fled from Japan to the United States before the war, surviving in New York. She returned to Japan in the 1950s, creating her famous polka dot style. During the 1960s, she was active in the avant-garde movement, which gave way to large-scale work in the 1970s. In 2017, the Louvre purchased one of her works for $8.5 million; Kusama is currently the fifth most expensive living female artist. Many of her rooms still exist around the world and continue to inspire new fans, while her exhibitions have attracted record crowds in the United States.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese artist associated with the pop art movement. Kusama grew up as an outsider because of her red hair. After finishing her training in Matsumoto in 1952, she moved to New York. During this period, she had a break from painting due the depression that came with living in New York and feeling isolated from the art community. While living in London in 1957, she painted her iconic dot paintings for the first time and returned to the art world. After living in New York for another few years, she decided to move to Europe and lived in France, Italy, Russia, and other places until settling in Japan.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (1929-present) is a Japanese avant-garde artist working in a variety of media. She trained at the Kyoto City School of Fine Arts before moving to New York in the 1950s. Her "Infinity Mirror Room" series explored themes of repetition and self-obsession. Kusama suffered from mental illness and experienced institutionalization several times before her career took off in the 1980s and 1990s, when museum exhibitions promoted her work. Kusama became the world's first living female artist to be honored at the Whitney Museum of American Art in 2018.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese artist whose work is characterized by repetition and abstraction. A central proponent of the avant-garde art movement Fluxus, Kusama is best known for her mirror rooms and dots. She was a fixture at the New York club scene in the early 1960s, often wearing a black wig and matching polka dots. She is one of the most successful contemporary artists, bringing in over $200 million in 2019, with major installations in theaters and museums around the world.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese contemporary artist who rose to prominence in the mid-1950s. She works in New York and Tokyo making performances, films, installations, paintings, and sculptures. Kusama is associated with the Pop Art, minimalist, and feminist movements. She was the first Japanese woman to be included in the Venice Biennale. Her work has been exhibited widely across the United States and Europe.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese artist, filmmaker, and writer. She began producing work in the Abstract Expressionist style, but moved towards a style that utilized repetition over the course of her career. Kusama's distinctive style includes hallucinatory representations of her own naked or semi-naked body, flowers, dots, and obsessive red staircases. She has gained attention as one of the most popular living artists in the world, particularly in her native Japan. Kusama has been cited as one of the most influential living artists.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese avant-garde artist and sculptor. She rose to prominence in New York in the early 1960s, showcasing her paintings and installations, the latter featuring mirror-filled rooms and bright hibiscus flowers. Kusama's work is marked by psychological themes and polka dots. She left Japan in 1977, seeking asylum in the United States, where she lives today, and returning to Japan in 2017. Her work frequently centers on mental health and infinity, and some is on exhibit at the Getty Center in Los Angeles.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output: Yayoi Kusama (born 1929) is a Japanese multimedia artist. In the 1950s, Kusama traveled to New York, where she collaborated with Andy Warhol and found fame. She returned to Japan, establishing the Infinity Museum. Kusama has suffered from hallucinations and mental illness for much of her life. Kusama's works have included paintings, installations, performances and sculptures. She is primarily known for her series of "Infinity Net" installations, a popular and widespread series of dotted circles. A prominent 1993 retrospective in New York popularized her as a major artist.

input: Write a short biography of Yayoi Kusama.
output:
Yayoi Kusama
(born 1929) is a Japanese artist famous for her unique vision and eclectic work. Kusama achieved success in the New York art scene in the 1950s and 1960s for her Pop Art-influenced paintings and drawings and psychedelic environments. After returning to Japan in 1973, Kusama abandoned the art world and became a self-proclaimed institution in her own mind. Despite struggles with mental illness, the artist's work has garnered widespread recognition in recent times. Kusama has been called "the world's greatest living female artist" and has exhibited at the New Museum and Hirshhorn Museum.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese-American musician, artist, and peace activist. Ono is best known for her involvement with John Lennon, with whom she had a famous romantic relationship in the 1960s. They married in 1969. Ono has continued her art career throughout her life, with notable exhibitions in New York, London, and Berlin, and numerous performances on both coasts of the US. Her artwork focuses on childhood, feminist themes, and social justice, and it highlights ways in which human suffering can spark creativity.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese musician, singer, filmmaker, and peace activist. A feminist and second wife of John Lennon, Ono is known for her art and campaigns in support of human rights and nuclear disarmament. She recorded the peace anthem "Give Peace A Chance" at Lennon's 1978 "Concert for World Peace," where she and Lennon met. Although married to several musicians, Ono began writing her own songs as a teenager. She released albums throughout the 1970s before her marriage to Lennon. In 1972, her son, Sean Ono Lennon, was born.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) was a Japanese conceptual artist and widow of pop musician John Lennon. While not widely known as an artist herself, she was affiliated with New York's avant-garde Fluxus art scene and was the creator of public performances such as Instruction Paintings. After marrying Lennon in 1969, Ono became a member of the Beatles, but her efforts to promote Lennon's music met with little success. The couple divorce in 1974 after he recorded a solo album that was seen by many as being critical of their relationship. In 1981, John Lennon was murdered outside The Dakota building in New York, where they lived. Ono continued to be associated with Lennon's remaining bandmates after his death. In her artistic works, she's focused on raising awareness of sociopolitical issues, collaborating with artists such as Björk, Antony, and the Flaming Lips. Her work has been exhibited worldwide, garnering international attention.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese-American artist and political activist best known for her work with John Lennon. She co-founded the Plastic Ono band with John in 1970 and married him in 1969. Yoko worked with John on a variety of records, including The Beatles' final album, Let It Be. Yoko was often criticized by Beatles fans for being an obstructive influence and disrupting the Fab Four's writing process. She continues to draw criticism as John's widow, but her artistic output has been well-received.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese conceptual artist, singer, activist and human rights advocate. She was married to John Lennon of the Beatles until he was murdered in 1980. She has produced seminal art, most famously the "War is Over" campaign in 1969, and has recorded numerous albums, including 1980's One Day, which spent 143 weeks on the Billboard chart. The peace prize in her name has been awarded numerous times, such as to Kofi Annan, Lech Walesa and Aung San Suu Kyi .

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is an artist, musician, writer, and activist. In the 1960s, she met and briefly married John Lennon and later became a prominent figure in the anti-Vietnam War and feminist movements. She wrote the lyrics of several of the Beatles' songs, including "Give Peace a Chance." She has been the subject of documentary films and controversy, including a 2000 tribute concert at which several performers declined to participate and protests of some of her performances.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese artist, singer, and peace activist, best known for her marriage to John Lennon. Born into a wealthy family, she studied philosophy and art before a career as a performance artist and filmmaker. In 1968, Ono staged an exhibition with Lennon's performance-artist associates, and they were married the next year. Ono's music career and associations with political causes, from feminism to gun control, have garnered mixed reviews. Since 2018, she has been an artist-in-residence at New York's Museum of Modern Art.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (1933-2021) was a Japanese musician. She met John Lennon in 1967 and soon became an activist. She co-wrote the "Ballad of John and Yoko" and composed the 1971 anti-Vietnam War song "John Sinclair". After Lennon's assassination in 1980, she became a peace activist, releasing the WAR IS OVER! album. In the 1990s, Ono resumed her musical career, producing the album Rising. She won the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement at the 2009 Venice Biennale.

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese American musician, poet, artist, and peace activist. She is best known for her avant-garde conceptual and performance art and music, and her marriage to Beatle John Lennon. Yoko met John in 1966, and they married the next year. After their separation in the mid-70s, she focused on performance art and promoting peace. She published two books, Grapefruit (1964) and Airprint (1986).

input: Write a short biography of Yoko Ono.
output: Yoko Ono (born 1933) is a Japanese-American multimedia artist and producer. Ono's work includes experimental musical collaborations, book art, and work for film and dance. She married John Lennon in 1969, and the couple led protests against the Vietnam War in the 1970s. Ono also campaigned for world peace. She wrote and performed the single "Walking on Thin Ice" at the 1984 Democratic National Convention.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 2000) is an American professional basketball player. A forward, he plays for the NBA's Dallas Mavericks. Williamson, a consensus top NBA prospect, played college basketball at Duke University. He was named Player of the Year in 2018-19. During his freshman season, Williamson shattered a shoe during a game, and the fall was captured on camera and dubbed "The Shot," after the Jumpman logo on his Nike sneakers. Nike reportedly paid him $40 million before joining the league. A major social media star, Williamson has used his celebrity for philanthropy.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 2000) is an American professional basketball player for the New Orleans Pelicans. A star athlete for Spartanburg Day School in South Carolina, Williamson won Naismith Player of the Year honors in 2019. The Atlanta Hawks picked Williamson #1 in the 2019 NBA Draft, but he was traded to New Orleans on draft night. In the 2021-22 season he led the Pelicans to the NBA Western Conference Finals and was named NBA Most Valuable Player, the first teenager to win the award. At the same time, rumors continue to swirl about whether Williamson will sit out of the league indefinitely over concerns about his safety.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 1999) is a professional basketball player for the Chicago Bulls, who has twice won the NBA's Most Valuable Player award. A member of Duke Blue Devils basketball team, he is widely considered a future Hall of Famer. Williamson is a dynamic offensive player and a clutch shooter and rebounder. He has been described as a once-in-a-generation talent by sports pundits. In 2020, after he was drafted with the first pick, he played in the NBA and was named league and Finals MVP. Williamson was the centerpiece of the Duke team that played for the title in 2019, losing to national champion Gonzaga. He won another title in 2022.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 1996) is an American professional basketball player who has played for the New Orleans Pelicans of the National Basketball Association. Williamson was a top high school recruit, drawing national headlines when he blew out his shoe during a game. He played college basketball at Duke University, helping the squad to the 2019 NCAA Championship. Williamson was drafted by New Orleans with the first overall pick in the 2019 NBA draft. In 2020, he finished second in league MVP voting and helped the Pelicans win the 2020 NBA Finals.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 2000) is an American basketball player for the New Orleans Pelicans. The 6-foot-7-inch forward dominated his college career at Duke University, winning two national championships, earning an NCAA National Player of the Year award, and leading the country with 22.6 points per game. He was chosen 1st overall in the 2019 NBA draft and signed a $126 million rookie contract with the New Orleans Pelicans. In his rookie season, he became the seventh player to score at least 22 points in each of his first three NBA games. A 2020 sports analyst named Williamson as the athlete of the decade.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 1999) is a basketball player with the New Orleans Pelicans. Williamson was drafted first in 2019, breaking the record for the highest draft pick. He then suffered a season-ending injury during an exhibition game, missing the 2019-2020 season. After the Pelicans secured a second-round playoff victory, Williamson was drafted again by the New York Knicks. He was named league MVP in 2022-2023.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 1999) is an American college basketball player and an early favorite to be chosen No. 1 overall in the 2019 NBA Draft. The Duke forward won the 2018 ACC Player of the Year as a freshman. Williamson helped lead his team to the 2019 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship final. In the draft, the New Orleans Pelicans selected him as first overall selection. He was named 2019 NBA Rookie of the Year.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 1999) is a professional American basketball player who plays for the Charlotte Hornets of the NBA. A native of Petersburg, Virginia; he was the first overall draft pick in 2019. Williamson led Duke University to the NCAA tournament Championship and was selected College Player of the Year in 2019. He is 6'6" tall and weighs 285 pounds.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 1999) is an American professional basketball player. Williamson, the Duke Blue Devils' projected first round pick, received college men's basketball's highest honor-- the Wooden Award-- and was named the 2019 College Basketball Player of the Year and Naismith Men's College Player of the Year. Williamson, a McDonald’s All American, played one season of college basketball as a freshman at Duke. The future NBA draft pick won the 2019 NCAA Tournament game-winning tipoff at Wisconsin with one second remaining in the game. NBA teams coveted Williamson's combination of skills, making him the No. 1 pick in the 2019 NBA Draft, with the Pelicans landing him. Williamson suffered a knee injury in the second game of the 2019-20 season and was out for over eight months before returning March 14, 2021.

input: Write a short biography of Zion Williamson.
output: Zion Williamson (born 2000) is a professional basketball player and small forward for the New Orleans Pelicans of the National Basketball Association. At the University of Duke, he was a key member of an NCAA championship team, winning most outstanding freshman in 2018. Williamson won college and NBA rookie of the year in 2019, becoming the second consecutive Duke player to take the honor. In 2021, Williamson broke the three-point record with 215 3-pointers in his first two seasons; he set multiple NBA rookie records. Williamson is an explosive scorer and has led the Pelicans to the playoffs in 2021 and 2022.

input: Write a short biography of Zora Neale Hurston.
output: Zora Neale Hurston (1891-1960) was an author and anthropologist. Born to former slaves in Alabama, Hurston moved to New York to study at Barnard College and became a scholar of black folk culture. Her novella "Their Eyes Were Watching God" received wide praise and she wrote about other African-American experiences in books like "Mules and Men." Hurston left academic work in the 1940s. The 1970 release of her memoir "Dust Tracks on a Road" helped revive her reputation.

input: Write a short biography of Zora Neale Hurston.
output: Zora Neale Hurston (1903-1960) was a novelist and folklorist who chronicled the struggles of African Americans in the South. She was a childhood friend of author Langston Hughes, who urged her to publish her work. The Harlem Renaissance, an intellectual and cultural movement, embraced Hurston's writing, but later she was criticized in black communities for her portrayals of African Americans. Hurston moved to Florida during the Great Depression. Her most famous books are Their Eyes Were Watching God and Seraph on the Suwannee River. She worked as a folklorist for the Library of Congress.

input: Write a short biography of Zora Neale Hurston.
output: Zora Neale Hurston (1891-1960) was an African American anthropologist and author. As early as 1927, she began writing fiction and folklore; her 1937 novel Their Eyes Were Watching God earned her international recognition. input: Write a short biography of Walt Disney.
output: Walter Elias "Walt" Disney (1901-1966) was an American animator, businessman, voice actor, author, director, producer, and actor. input: Write a short biography of Walt Disney.
output: Walter Elias "Walt" Disney (1901-1966) was an American film producer, director, and voice actor. After Walt Disney died in 1966, his brother Roy O. Disney took control of the company, which was rebranded as Walt Disney Productions in 1986. Roy Disney died in 1971, and Walt Disney Company was renamed Walt Disney Studios. Roy's son, Michael Eisner, led Disney from 1984 to 2006. Eisner was succeeded by Robert Iger, who oversaw Disney's $71.3 billion acquisition of 21st Century Fox in 2019.

input: Write a short biography of Walt Disney.

input: Write a short biography of Walt Disney.
